alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 09 at 3:58PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: .Runoff from heavy rainfall overnight continues to impact the region causing elevated streamflows. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Copper River Basin. This includes the cities of Glennallen, Eureka, Mccarthy, Paxson, And Slana. * WHEN...Through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks and flooding may occur in areas of poor drainage and across low roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Light to Moderate rain has fallen overnight throughout the Copper River Valley. Two day rain totals of between 1 and 1.5 inches were reported within the upper Copper River Valley. Light to moderate rain is expected to continue overnight with an additional 1 to 2 inches possible allong the eastern Denali Highway. The MacLaren River rose rapidly overnight to bankfull with areas likely out of bank. As of Friday afternoon the MacLaren River was still slowly rising and is expected to crest Friday night. No significant flood impacts were reported along the Denali Highway or Richardson Highway as of Friday afternoon. Heavy rain was reported in Chitina and McCarthy overnight with the Kennicott River rising rapidly overnight and continuing to rise as of Friday afternoon. The Kennicott River is expected to remain below bankfull but may experience increase erosion with the elevated water levels. - Http://www.weather.gov/aprfc
info.instruction: Boaters along rivers in the Copper River Valley should monitor water levels and prepare for possible continued rises overnight. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Please do not drive through flooded areas, turn around, don`t drown.
